page.title: 08BUILDINGS 2
page.content:
18th Century It is likely that many of the buildings that line the High Street and West Street were rebuilt or more probably refronted during the 18th and 19th centuries. Little evidence of typical 18th century architecture now survives but mention should be made of the Gables Carvery (number 33 High Street) Exmoor House Hotel (number 12 West Street) and the Conygar Tower built about 1775.
19th Century The new buildings of the 19th century and the alterations to existing ones had quite an impact. In 1801 the Castle Mill was rebuilt and the Mill House and by 1868 many of the older cottages in The Ball and Park Street had been rebuilt or altered. Major new buildings followed, the Primary School
